Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: DUAL SERVICE MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FOR EMPLOYEE SERVICES Southwest Tennessee Community College Tennessee Board of Regents VENDOR PARTY PROCURING PARTY This memorandum signifies agreement of the above parties concerning the provision of employee services. The agreement is as follows: 1. Vendor agrees to furnish the services of its full-time employee, Todd Blankenbeckler, Social Security No. f Address: STCC, Macon Cove Campus, 5983 Macon Cove, Memphis, TN 3c ±34 who will perform the following services for procuring party: • Design and develop an online course in the Desire2Learn software which focuses on ADA compliance and accommodation in online courses within the Tennessee Board of Regents. The course is to be developed to be non-credit and taken without the active participation of an instructor. The course is to be completed before the beginning of the Fall semester of 2007. • Present and provide consultation at one of the TBR RODP Summer Institutes during the Summer of 2007. 2. Compensation to vendor party: $2,500 Base Amount $155.00 FICA-6.2% $36.25 Medicare - 1.45% $250,00 Retirement - 10% for ORP Total: $2,941.25 This amount is payable upon invoicing on or after August 31, 2007 Maximum liability of procuring party $2,941.25. 3. Payment will be made by procuring party after completion of service and after receipt of invoice from vendor party, mailed to the following address: Deanna Hall, Director of Fiscal Services Tennessee Board of Regents 1415 Murfreesboro Road, Suite 350 Nashville, TN 37217 4. Contract term: June 15, 2007 through August 31, 2007. Either party may terminate this agreement by giving written notice to the other at least 30 days before the effective date of termination. In that event, vendor shall be entitled to receive just and equitable compensation for any satisfactory work completed as of the termination date. In addition, procuring party shall have the right to immediately terminate this agreement and withhold payments in excess of fair compensation for work completed in the event that the employee fails to perform in a timely and proper manner or breaches any material term of this agreement. 6. This agreement cannot be assigned or subcontracted without the written consent of all parties. Dated this 23rd day of May, 2007. SOUTHWEST TENNESSEE COMMUNITY COLLEGE By.
